Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Imageless Navigation in Total Hip Arthroplasty

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included patients scheduled for primary THA. The study was conducted at a single orthopedic center.

Intervention.evidence: randomised to surgery with or without imageless navigation

Objective.evidence: This study investigates whether imageless navigation reduces psoas impingement compared to standard techniques.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the anterior protrusion of the cup above the acetabular rim, assessed postoperatively on 3-D CT by a blinded external institute.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, with allocation concealment.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Cup anteversion (HR, 0.87; 95% CI, 0.81–0.93; p < 0.001) and female sex (HR, 3.88; 95% CI, 1.01–14.93; p = 0.049) were associated with potential psoas impingement.

Trial_Registration.evidence: The trial was registered under [Trial Registration Number].
